main event: Mr. and Mrs. [REDACTED] reported seeing a bright object flickering and changing brightness, followed by the sighting of three very bright objects that appeared motionless.
interesting points: The initial object was believed to be a star, likely Capella, which was stationary and flickering., The witnesses used binoculars to observe the objects, which appeared as colored domes and horizontal lights., Two different sightings occurred; the second sighting involved three very bright objects that were irregularly shaped., The phenomenon of diffraction through a window screen likely affected the appearance of the objects., The conclusion was made that the objects were probably astronomical in nature, likely planets.
sighted object: one bright flickering object followed by three bright irregular shapes
witness description: Mr. and Mrs. [REDACTED], with Mrs. [REDACTED] being a secretary and Mr. [REDACTED] a director of communications.
